@lululemon X @_embassyreit came through with one of the best #IYD events in Bangalore. The best part?? I got to share the stage with @vinyasavik and convey the message of Yoga 🧘‍♀️ 

We meditated, we stretched, we moved….we were one community! 

Let’s practice, meditate & progress 🤝🧘‍♀️

#yogareels #yogaevents #yogaevent #internationalyogaday #iyd2024 #bangaloreyoga #yogacommunity

If you don’t know me yet ….

I am Riya Davda, a trained and certified yoga instructor based out of Bangalore but a world citizen by heart. 

I strongly believe that yoga comes to you when you need it the most. I found yoga as a teenager going through anxiety and uncertainty. The physical practices lead to mental relaxation which eventually translated to a new sense of purpose. 

Now, I am in the mission to promote yoga for the youth and the modern man. You don’t have to escape to the mountains, detach from your day to day activities and commitments. All you have to do is, show up for as less as 10 minutes, choose what suits you and proceed with this blissful journey called - yoga.

I have worked with clients and companies from across the 🌏. Join 500+ individuals who have been to a RD Yoga session and experience yoga for the modern man.

Reach out to me for private sessions, corporate sessions, youth awareness programs and sleep enhancing sessions! 

📞 +91-8095429222
📧 riyadyoga@gmail.com
📍worldwide

MUD & GLOW ✨
Ever soaked in volcanic mud on purpose? New Zealand’s natural mud baths are packed with minerals that detox, exfoliate, and relax you like never before!

In the third episode of - What’s in Wellness, I took the plunge into Rotorua’s geothermal goodness and got messy for the sake of self-care. 

Nothing screams Wellness that natures spa and I’m so glad I experienced it. And trust me, I was SO Zen’d out after this. I could just 😴 

Would you try a mud bath? 👇

[ Rotorua , wellness , wellness travel , New Zealand , self care , nature spa , spa , skin care , volcanic mud , relaxation , calm ]

According to Ayurveda, your mouth is the gateway to your gut.

That’s why oil pulling - the practice of swishing oil in your mouth 
-  has been used for centuries to support oral health, detoxification, and overall wellness.

Start with just 5 minutes, and eventually move to 15-20 minutes. And the best way to distract yourself is by going ahead with your morning chores.

In this episode of What’s in Wellness, I tried coconut oil pulling every morning for a week. And let me tell you… it’s like a workout for your mouth 🥵

My gums feel healthier, my mouth feels fresher, and I swear my jaw feels slightly more chiseled 😅

Is it ancient magic or modern myth? I break it down.

Would you give this wellness ritual a shot?
👇 Let me know!

#WhatsInWellness #OilPulling #AyurvedaLifestyle #MouthWorkout #JawlineJournals #CoconutOilCure #WellnessTriedAndTested #HolisticHealth

FACE ICE BATHS ❄️🧊 the skincare hack you didn’t know you needed!

After trying full-body ice baths (yes, the dramatic kind with 50kgs of ice cubes and mental prep), I was on the lookout for something quicker, simpler, and more skin-focused…

Enter: Face Ice Baths ✨

Why I’m obsessed:
✅ Takes less than 5 minutes
✅ No fancy setup - just a bowl, water, and ice
✅ Soothes inflammation + de-puffs the skin
✅ Instant glow up before meetings or a night out
✅ A perfect pick-me-up during those hot, sluggish afternoons

I highly recommend giving this wellness trend a shot — especially if you’re looking for a quick skin refresh without spending a dime.

💬 Would you try it? Drop a ❄️ in the comments if you’re in!
👇 Tag a friend who needs this skincare hack in their life!

#faceicebath #icebath #skincarehack #glowup #wellnesstrends #whatsinwellness #wellnesspodcast #lifestylehacks

Wellness trends are all over the place, and I’m curious about the all. Join me as I explore them and share them with you 🥰 consider this as a journal of my experiments and experiences.

If you’re in Phuket, Thailand, you gotta drop by 🥰

Yoga isn’t confined to the mat, and @featherliteofficefurniture  beautifully brought this to life through their International Day of Yoga campaign.

By incorporating asanas using a chair, they highlighted the power of props - a concept deeply rooted in the Iyengar style of Yoga.

This purposeful campaign did two things: it showcased the versatility of their product, and it paid homage to traditional yoga practices.

Thank you @featherliteofficefurniture for making me a part of this fun and thoughtful shoot!

International Day of Yoga, with Intention🙏

The true meaning of yoga is “to unite”, and that’s exactly what we embodied this International Day of Yoga with lululemon 

In a beautiful celebration that blended IDY with Pride Month, we created space for inclusivity, expression, and connection. Over 100 people came together at one location, united by one intention: to honour and celebrate each individual, just as they are.

What I deeply admire about lululemon  is its commitment to community, creating moments that are not just about movement, but about how we make each other feel.

This would not have been possible without pure collaboration @avadhanam_abhyasa . So glad to have met you through this journey 🙏

Thanks to the entire team at lululemon India for making this event possible.

Here’s to more purposeful collaborations and continuing to share the message and magic of Yoga 🧘‍♀️

#lululemon #wellness #internationaldayofyoga #yoga #yogaevent #lululemoncommunity #yogateacher #lululemonevent

This is just the beginning of a quiet revolution in how we travel.

Airports around the world—from Dubai to Dallas—have embraced yoga as a way to make travel more mindful. And now, it’s India’s turn.

This International Day of Yoga, I had the incredible opportunity to be one of the first yoga teachers to lead a session at an Indian airport. Invited by the beautifully designed 080 Lounge at Kempegowda International Airport (T2), I conducted an experiential session for travellers passing through the lounge.

From demonstrating simple travel-friendly stretches to answering questions about yoga and wellness on the go, I got to combine my two biggest passions: travel and yoga.

The 080 Lounge isn’t just a waiting space—it’s a sanctuary. That they chose to integrate yoga into their guest experience speaks volumes about the future of travel in India: conscious, calming, and connected to well-being.

Words don’t do justice to what this experience meant to me. But if this is what the future of airports looks like, count me all in.

Let’s make mindful travel the new norm. 🙏🏽

#InternationalYogaDay #AirportYoga #TravelWellness #YogaTeacherLife #KempegowdaAirport #WellnessOnTheGo #YogaEverywhere #yogaindia
